Title: HR
SubTitle: HashRate
Description: Mine a Block on your Chain using HashRate.
Information: The amount of computing power being consumed by the network to continuously operate. Secures the network.

SubTitle: 51% Attack
Description: Steal the target's latest Block (and reward).
Information: If more than half the computer power on a network is run by a single entity, then a 51% attack is in operation.

Title: CONS.
SubTitle: Consensus
Description: Protect your Chain once.
Information: Consensus is achieved when all participants of the network agree on the order and content of blocks and transactions contained in those blocks.

Title: ATH
SubTitle: All Time High
Description: You are challenged so that all players get +1/0 HashRate.
Information: The highest point (in price, in market capitalization) that a cryptocurrency has been in history.

Title: ATL
SubTitle: All Time Low
Description: You are challenged so that all players get 0/-1 HashRate.
Information: The lowest point (in price, in market capitalization) that a cryptocurrency has been in history.

Title: BEAR
SubTitle: Bearish
Description: Target looses 1 HashRate.
Information: Bear: A person who is pessimistic about market prices and expects them to decline, also known to be 'bearish'.

Title: BOT
SubTitle: Trading Bot
Description: Challenge another player: 1 vs 1 HashRate.
Information: Automated trading software bots that execute trade orders extremely quickly, based on a preset algorithm of buy-and-sell rules.

Title: BTFD
SubTitle: Buy The F* Dip
Description: Get 1 HashRate. Opponents are challenged to get +1/0 HashRate.
Information: An enthusiastic exclamation by supporters of a cryptocurrency to buy while prices are at a low point.

Title: BULL
SubTitle: Bullish
Description: Get 2 HashRate.
Information: Bull: A person that is optimistic and confident that market prices will increase, also known to be 'bullish'.

Title: BYZ.
SubTitle: Byzantine's Generals
Description: You must all reach consensus to get 1 HashRate or 1 Coin each. Any means are allowed.
Information: Byzantine Generals’ Problem: A situation where communication that requires consensus on a single strategy from all members within a group or party cannot be trusted or verified.

Title: CEX
SubTitle: Centralized Exchange
Description: Swap 1 HashRate for 1 Coin.
Information: A centralized organizational structure is one in which a single node or a small number of them are in control of an entire network.

Title: DCA
SubTitle: Dollar Cost Average
Description: Swap 1 Coin for 2 HashRate.
Information: An investment strategy in which an investor divides up the total amount to be invested across periodic purchases of a target asset.

Title: DEX
SubTitle: Decentralized Exchange
Description: Target must trade you 2 HashRate for any card you want from your Hand.
Information: A peer-to-peer exchange that allows users to buy and sell cryptocurrency and other assets without a central intermediary involved.

Title: DIFF--
SubTitle: Difficulty Decrease
Description: Your next Block requires 1 less HashRate to mine.
Information: Difficulty: A relative measure of how difficult it is to discover a new block. Adjusts periodically proportionally to the hashing power of the network of miners.

Title: DIFF++
SubTitle: Difficulty Increase
Description: Target's next Block requires 1 more HashRate to mine.
Information: Difficulty: A relative measure of how difficult it is to discover a new block. Adjusts periodically proportionally to the hashing power of the network of miners.

Title: DOUBLE
SubTitle: Double Spending
Description: Double the amount of HashRate you get, once.
Information: A situation where a sum of money is (illegitimately) spent more than once.

Title: FEES
SubTitle: Transaction Fees
Description: Your next Block rewards 1 extra Coin.
Information: Block Reward: By contributing to the security and liveness of the chain, the miner is rewarded with this incentive, ensuring that miners continue to act in the best interest of the blockchain.

Title: FIAT
SubTitle: Fiduciary Money
Description: Useless. (Get rid of it.)
Information: Fiat currency is 'legal tender' backed by a central government, such as the Federal Reserve, and with its own banking system, such as fractional reserve banking.

Title: FLIP
SubTitle: Flippening
Description: Swap Hand with an opponent. Ends your turn. Cannot be prevented.
Information: The Flippening is the transition of other cryptocurrencies (such as Ethereum) growing bigger, more important, and more valuable than the #1.

Title: FORK
SubTitle: Chain Split
Description: Target looses its last Block (and reward).
Information: Forks, or chain splits, create an alternate version of the blockchain, leaving two blockchains to run simultaneously.

Title: HALF
SubTitle: Halving
Description: Target's next block rewards 1 less Coin.
Information: An event in which the total rewarded coins per confirmed block halves. Enforces scarcity.

Title: HODL
SubTitle: Hold On for Dear Life
Description: Protect your Bank or your HashRate once.
Information: A type of passive investment strategy where you hold an investment regardless of any changes in the price or markets. The term first became famous due to a typo.

Title: ICO
SubTitle: Initial Coin Offering
Description: Challenge another player: 1 vs 2 HashRate.
Information: A type of crowdfunding, or crowdsale, using cryptocurrencies as a means of raising capital for early-stage companies.

Title: KYC
SubTitle: Know Your Customer
Description: Prove your (real) identity or drop your Hand. Seriously.
Information: This process refers to a centralized financial institution’s obligations to verify the identity of a customer in line with global anti-money laundering laws.

Title: MARGIN
SubTitle: Margin Call
Description: Target looses 1 Coin.
Information: When an investor’s account value falls below the margin maintenance amount. The broker will then demand that the investor deposit additional money to continue trading.

Title: MINE
SubTitle: Mining
Description: Mine a Block with the help of the Pool.
Information: A process where blocks are added to a blockchain, verifying transactions. It is also the process through which new coins are created.

Title: NONE
Description: Player(s) with the least number of Coin gets 1.
Information: A no-coiner is someone who has no cryptocurrency in his or her investment portfolio and firmly believes that cryptocurrency in general will fail.

Title: NONCE
Description: Target must trade you all its HashRate for 1 Coin.
Information: When a transaction is hashed by a miner, an arbitrary number meant to be used only once is generated, called a nonce.

Title: OFFLINE
Description: Protect any amount of HashRate once.
Information: Cold Storage: The act of storing cryptocurrencies in devices or systems not connected to the internet.

Title: ORACLE
Description: Everyone must reveal their Hand yo you.
Information: An agent that finds and verifies information, bridging the real world and the blockchain by providing data to smart contracts.

Title: P&D
SubTitle: Pump & Dump
Description: You are challenged to get +1/-1 HashRate while others get the opposite.
Information: A form of securities fraud involving the artificial inflation of the price of a cryptocurrency with false and misleading positive statements in order to sell at a higher price.

Title: POS
SubTitle: Proof-of-Stake
Description: Any player holding at least 1 HashRate gets 1 more from the Pool.
Information: A blockchain consensus mechanism involving choosing the creator of the next block via various combinations of random selection and wealth or age of staked coins or tokens.

Title: PONZI
SubTitle: Ponzi Scheme
Description: Challenge every opponent to give you 1 Coin or 1 HashRate.
Information: A fraudulent investment involving the payment of purported returns to existing investors from funds contributed by new investors.

Title: REKT
SubTitle: Wrecked
Description: Target must drop all HashRate in its Hand.
Information: A shorthand slang for 'wrecked', describing a bad loss in a trade.

Title: FOMO
SubTitle: Fear of Missing Out
Description: When a player just won HashRate from the Pool, you get the same amount.
Information: A term that is used to express the anxiety you could feel if you don’t act quickly / miss out on a potential opportunity.

Title: SCAM
Description: Steal 2 HashRate (if any) from the Target's Hand.
Information: A fraudulent or deceptive cryptocurrency or ICO.

Title: STABLE
SubTitle: Stablecoin
Description: Swap 1 Fiat (in Hand or from Pool) for 2 HashRate.
Information: A cryptocurrency with extremely low volatility. Examples include gold-backed cryptocurrency or fiat-pegged cryptocurrency.

Title: BCD
SubTitle: Diamond Hands
Description: Target wins any random challenge once. Can apply to yourself.
Information: Strong hands is a colloquial term that can refer to well-financed speculators or futures traders who wish to take delivery of the underlying asset.

Title: SYBIL
SubTitle: Sybil Attack
Description: All players loose their last Block (and reward).
Information: In a Sybil attack, the attacker subverts the reputation system of a network service by creating a large number of fake identities to gain a disproportionately large influence.

Title: T-L
SubTitle: Time-Lock
Description: Target cannot play cards from its Hand the turn following its next Block.
Information: A Timelock is a type of smart contract primitive that restricts the spending of coins until a specified future time or block height.

Title: TEST
SubTitle: Testnet
Description: Cancel the last played Action (that cannot be played again this turn).
Information: An alternative blockchain used by developers for testing.

Title: BCH
SubTitle: Paper Hands
Description: Target looses any random challenge once.
Information: Weak hands is the term often used to describe traders and investors who lack conviction in their strategies or lack the resources to carry them out.

Title: WHALE
Description: You get 2 HashRate or opponents loose 1 HashRate.
Information: A term used to describe investors who have uncommonly large amounts of crypto, especially those with enough funds to manipulate the market.
